org.drupal.project.computing

Class DConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drupal.project.computing.DConfig

  • public class DConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the config class to help initialize DSite and DApplication.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.logging.Logger logger 
      protected java.util.Properties properties
      This is the main place we save configurations.

        protected java.util.logging.Logger logger

        protected java.util.Properties properties
        This is the main place we save configurations. We don't use hard coded fields because we don't know which are needed.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • loadDefault

        public static DConfig loadDefault(boolean reload)
        Factory method. Load default config from config.properties file. Load priority: 1. Arbitrary properties file specified by java -Ddrupal.computing.config.file 2. Properties file in current working directory 3. Properties file in the same directory as the Jar file 4. Properties file in "user.home".
        Parameters:
        reload - specifies whether to read the config.properties file again, or use the cached one.
        Returns:
        A DConfig object with loaded properties.

      • loadDefault

        public static DConfig loadDefault()
        Returns:
        loadDefault(false)

      • getProperty

        public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                           java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Read priority: 1. Property set in this.properties. 2. Java system property 3. Property set in system ENV: replace '.' with '_' and lower case to upper case.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name to read.
        defaultValue - the default value.
        Returns:
        propertyValue if set, of defaultValue

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
               java.lang.String value)

      • getDatabaseUrl

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseUrl()
                                throws DConfigException
        Try to read "dcomp.database.url" in config.properties or system env. Throws exception if can't find.
        Returns:
        The database url string that can be used directly in JDBC connections.
        Throws:
        DConfigException
        See Also:
        Simple MySQL example, MySQL connection properties

      • getDatabaseProperties

        public java.util.Properties getDatabaseProperties()
                                           throws DNotFoundException
        Try to read "dcomp.database.properties.*" in config.properties. Requires to have "driver", "database", "username", "password" and "host" to be considered as valid. See more about db settings in Drupal settings.php. Extra parameters will be passed to database connection too.
        Returns:
        The database properties as defined in dcomp.database.properties.*. Or throws DNotFoundException.
        Throws:
        DNotFoundException
        See Also:
        Simple MySQL example, MySQL connection properties

      • getDrushCommand

        public java.lang.String getDrushCommand()
        Returns:
        The drush executable command.

      • getDrushSiteAlias

        public java.lang.String getDrushSiteAlias()
        Returns:
        The default drush site alias. Users should include "@" in the config file.

      • getAgentName

        public java.lang.String getAgentName()
        Retrieve the agent name either from config.properties, or from host name, or set as "Unknown".
        Returns:
        the agent name.
